sentence.Network_en: He has worked hard in recent months to portray New York in a better light.
sentence.Network_cn: 最近几个月里他努力从更积极的角度来描绘纽约。

sentence.Network_en: That's what we tried to portray in the book, this feeling of opulence and grandeur.
sentence.Network_cn: 那就是我们在书中竭力描绘的——一种富丽堂皇的气派。

sentence.Network_en: It is still not considered proper to portray Christ in a play or film.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们仍然认为在戏剧或电影中再现基督的形象是不妥当的.

list.abs: 什么意思... ... Portraying Buddhas 塑造佛像 character portraying 人物塑造 portraying characters 刻画人物.
the writer was portrayed as a terrible husband ., 那位作家被描绘成一位糟糕的丈夫.
the art of portraying characters and acting out situations or a narrative by gestures and body movement without the use of words ; pantomime哑剧，模拟表演用手势和身体的动作而不用言语来表现人物和场景或者来叙事的艺术；哑剧

this approach also gives us an opportunity to portray enemies with their own motivations : of doing something-in this case tunneling-instead of just waiting to be killed by players .同样地，这种方法也给了我们一个机会，能够详细地描述敌人“自己”的存在意义——在这个例子中就是“挖掘隧道”——而不是“傻傻地在原地等着玩家过来屠杀”

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French portraire, based on traire 'to draw', from an alteration of Latin trahere

entry.def: When an actor or actress portrays someone, he or she plays that person in a play or film.

example.ex: In 1975 he portrayed the king in a Los Angeles revival of 'Camelot'.
example.tran: 他1975年在洛杉矶重新上演的剧目《卡米洛》中扮演国王。

example.ex: ...the busty and rumbustious Mrs Hall, excellently portrayed by Toni Palmer.
example.tran: 由托妮·帕默精彩演绎的胸部丰满、吵吵嚷嚷的霍尔太太

entry.def: When a writer or artist portrays something, he or she writes a description or produces a painting of it.

example.ex: ...this northern novelist, who accurately portrays provincial domestic life.
example.tran: 这位准确描述外省家庭生活的北方小说家

example.ex: ...the landscape as portrayed by painters such as Claude and Poussin.
example.tran: 克劳德和普桑等画家所描绘的风景

entry.def: If a film, book, or television programme portrays someone in a certain way, it represents them in that way.

example.ex: She says the programme portrayed her as a 'lady of easy virtue'.
example.tran: 她说这个节目把她刻画成了一个“水性杨花的女人”。

example.ex: ...complaints about the way women are portrayed in adverts.
example.tran: 抗议在广告中如此刻画女性

sentences.sentence: "The book portrays the actor as a selfish person"
"Goya wanted to portray his mistress, the Duchess of Alba"

sentences.sentence: "The actor portrays an elderly, lonely man"

sentences.sentence: "The father is portrayed as a good-looking man in this painting"

sentences.en: The book portrayed his personal experience.
sentences.cn: 这本书描绘了他的个人经历。

sentences.en: He portrayed himself as a champion for democracy.
sentences.cn: 他把自己描绘成民主斗士。

sentences.en: He portrayed Napoleon in the play.

jushi.english: Dickins portrays his characters to the life.
jushi.chinese: 狄更斯描绘的人物栩栩如生。

jushi.english: This painting portrays the death of Nelson.
jushi.chinese: 这幅画描绘了纳尔逊之死。

jushi.english: He portrayed a character in this play.
jushi.chinese: 他在这个剧中扮演一个角色。
